definitions.definition: In , near , or in the general vicinity of (a particular place ).
examples: Caesar was at Rome; a climate treaty was signed at Kyoto in 1997.
I was at Jim’s house at the corner of Fourth Street and Vine.
at the bottom of the page; sitting at the table; at church; at sea
She's at Oxford University, studying chemistry.

subdefinitions.definition: Working for (a company) or in (a place or situation).
examples: He used to be at Lehman Brothers. Now he's at Merrill Lynch.
"Where does he work?" — "I think he's still at the solicitors."

subdefinitions.definition: Indicating distance or direction relative to the speaker.
examples: Target at five miles. Prepare torpedoes.
Look out! UFO at two o'clock!

definitions.definition: Present or taking place during (an event).
examples: Was he at the meeting?
There was a big fight at the class reunion.

definitions.definition: Indicating time of occurrence, especially an instant of time, or a period of time relatively short in context or from the speaker’s perspective.
examples: at six o’clock; at dawn; at closing time; at the age of twelve; at night; at the moment

definitions.definition: In the direction of; towards; ( often implied to be in a hostile or careless manner ).
examples: Don’t just talk at someone; really listen to what they have to say.
Stones were thrown at us, but we coudn't see who did.
He shouted at her.
She pointed at the curious animal.

definitions.definition: Indicating action bearing upon something, especially continued or repeated action.
examples: Don't pick at your food!
My cat keeps scratching at the furniture.
I was working at the problem all day.
At my request, they agreed to move us to another hotel.
He jumped at the sudden noise.
We laughed at the joke.
She was mad at their comments.
men at work; children at play
The two countries are at war.
She is at sixes and sevens with him.
They are at loggerheads over how best to tackle the fiscal cliff.
We hope that the event will go ahead, but we are at the whim of the weather.
The city was at the mercy of the occupying forces.
3 apples at 2¢ (each)
The offer was at $30,000 before negotiations.

definitions.definition: Indicates a position on a scale or in a series.
examples: Sell at $90.
Tiger finished the round at tenth, seven strokes behind the leaders.
I’m offering it—just to select customers— at cost .
The river is at its highest in spring.
These babies weigh in at ten tons apiece.
at best ; at most ; at worst ; at least

definitions.definition: In certain phrases, used to indicate the manner in which something happens or is done.
examples: The car came towards me at speed.
He spoke at great length on the topic.
The winner will be chosen at random.

definitions.definition: Indicates a specific speed or rate that is maintained by something.
examples: We were cruising along at well over the speed limit of fifty miles per hour.
It is growing at the rate of 3% a year.
"How was the painting sold?" — " At auction."

definitions.definition: or areas of knowledge ) On the subject of; regarding .
examples: The twins were both bad at chemistry.
He slipped at marksmanship over his extended vacation.

definitions.definition: Also used in various other idiomatic combinations: at a pinch , at all , at fault , at pains , at risk , at that , etc.; see the individual entries.

main_definition: In , near , or in the general vicinity of (a particular place ).
secondary_definitions: Present or taking place during (an event).
Indicating time of occurrence, especially an instant of time, or a period of time relatively short in context or from the speaker’s perspective.
In the direction of; towards; ( often implied to be in a hostile or careless manner ).
Indicating action bearing upon something, especially continued or repeated action.
Indicates a position on a scale or in a series.
In certain phrases, used to indicate the manner in which something happens or is done.
Indicates a specific speed or rate that is maintained by something.
( used for skills (including in activities) or areas of knowledge ) On the subject of; regarding .
( Ireland , stressed pronunciation ) Bothering, irritating, causing discomfort to
Also used in various other idiomatic combinations: at a pinch , at all , at fault , at pains , at risk , at that , etc.; see the individual entries.
